column4: gksudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst and change the default to whatever line number windows would appear at in that list
I installed Linux after Vista and unlike with XP Vista wasn't auto detected and I have no entry for it and I'm screwed.....
I believe you can configure grub to do it, I've never had to though
Darn, I can't seem to get help with this and I really need to be able to get into Vista tonight. Thanks for trying to help.
